body_html:
This is kind of expected. There are two main problems at play here:

  1. RNG calls are not functional - they mutate the state of the global PRNG, and therefore we probably shouldn't rearrange them. This however requires us to add the "world token" to inhibit optimizations.
  2. We never trace constructors. If we want to do this, we probably need to make the tracing a thread-local property, instead of auto-detecting it as a per-Variable property.

This is kind of expected. There are two main problems at play here:

RNG calls are not functional - they mutate the state of the global PRNG, and therefore we probably shouldn't rearrange them. This however requires us to add the "world token" to inhibit optimizations.
We never trace constructors. If we want to do this, we probably need to make the tracing a thread-local property, instead of auto-detecting it as a per-Variable property.
body:
This is kind of expected. There are two main problems at play here:

1. RNG calls are not functional - they mutate the state of the global PRNG, and therefore we probably shouldn't rearrange them. This however requires us to add the "world token" to inhibit optimizations.
2. We never trace constructors. If we want to do this, we probably need to make the tracing a thread-local property, instead of auto-detecting it as a per-Variable property.
